StudyObjective: To explore neural correlates of threat processing in panic disorder (PD) patients by means of script-driven imagery based on controlled disorder-related and neutral scenarios.

fMRITasks.TaskDescription: Participants listened to disorder-related and neutral narrative scripts and imagined the active role of the protagonist, which elicited emotional and physiological responses similar to real-life threats.
fMRITasks.DesignDetails: The task was event-related with pseudo-randomized trials. Each script lasted 30 seconds, with an inter-trial interval of 20 seconds. Participants were instructed to keep their eyes closed and concentrate on the sounds during the inter-trial interval. The task lasted approximately 9 minutes.
TaskMetrics: BOLD response in brain regions (amygdala, PFC, ACC, brainstem)
Subjective ratings of anxiety, arousal, and valence
